events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed an initial claim to start the insurance process.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the incident details provided by the policyholder.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and coordinate communication between customer and company.
Claim acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming that their auto accident claim is being processed.
Request for police report, photos of vehicle damages, and driver’s license was sent to the claimant.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the accident report and vehicle damage photos.
Investigation initiated to verify accident details and assess liability and extent of damage to vehicle.
Investigation completed with findings that confirm the insured’s vehicle was damaged due to third-party fault.
Proposal for claim settlement amount sent to customer outlining the coverage and recommended payment.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and requested expedited payment processing.
The claim was approved based on investigation results and acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment corresponding to the approved claim amount was issued to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that all procedures are complete.
All documentation and case files related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
